title: Clinic Protection
description:
States that provide protections related to a facility or healthcare provider that provides abortion services.

*no data

title: Clinic Obstruction
description:
States that prohibit blocking the entrance to and from clinic facilities.

*no data

title: Clinic Threats
description:
States that prohibit threatening or intimidating staff who provide reproductive health services and/or patients entering the clinic.

*no data

title: Clinic Damage
description:
States that prohibit property damage to facilities providing reproductive health services.

*no data

title: Clinic Telephone Harrasment
description:
States that prohibit telephone harassment of staff who provide reproductive health services.

*no data

title: Clinic General Harassment
description:
States that prohibit other specified actions, such as creating excessive noise outside the clinic, possessing or having access to a weapon during a demonstration at a medical facility, trespassing, or releasing a substance that produces noxious odor on clinic premises.

*no data

title: Clinic Buffer Zone
description:
Sates that have established a buffer zone around a person within a specific distance of a clinic's entrance or driveway.

*no data

title: Bans After Cetrain Number of Weeks
description:
State gestational bans represented as weeks since last missed period. Restrictions vary depending on trimester, viability and fertilization.

*no data

title: Exception to Save a Pregnant Person's Life
description:
States that abortion is not banned if necessary to save the pregnant person's life.

*no data

title: Exception to Preserve a Pregnant Person's Health
description:
States that abortion is not banned if necessary to preserve the pregnant person's health.

*no data

title: Exception to Preserve the Health of a Fetus
description:
States where exceptions may be granted based on the health or status of the fetus.

*no data

title: Exception in the case of Rape or Incest
description:
States where exceptions may be granted in cases of rape or incest.

*no data

title: Medicaid Coverage
description:
States that have a policy in place to use Medicaid funds to pay for abortion, most of these states require coverage for "medically necessary" abortion. This is a vaguely-defined criterion usually based on a decision between a pregnant person and their medical provider and can include circumstances beyond physical health, such as mental or emotional health or familial situations.

*no data

title: Medicaid Coverage Exception to Save a Life
description:
States that allow Medicaid insurance coverage for cases where abortion is necessary to save the pregnant person's life (this is required by the Hyde amendment).

*no data

title: Medicaid Coverage Exception to Save a Person's Health
description:
States that allow Medicaid insurance coverage for cases when the pregnant person's physical health is endangered. Medicaid is a federal-state insurance program.

*no data

title: Medicaid Exception to Preserve the Health of a Fetus
description:
States that allow Medicaid insurance coverage for cases when the fetus has a serious or lethal fetal anomaly. Medicaid is a federal-state insurance program.

*no data

title: Medicaid Exception in the case of Rape or Incest
description:
States that allow Medicaid insurance coverage for cases of rape or incest (this is required by the Hyde amendment).

*no data

title: Age of a Minor
description:
The age below which restrictions apply. For the most part, these restrictions apply to minors under the age of 18.

*no data

title: Parental Consent
description:
States where a parent or parents must give permission for the minor to have an abortion. Some states require both consent and notification through separate laws.

*no data

title: Parental Notification
description:
States that require that a parent or parents must be told beforehand of the minor's decision to have an abortion. Some states require notification 48 hours before, some require notification 24 hours before, and some just require "before".

*no data

title: Number of Parents Notified
description:
States that require either one parent or both parents to be notified. Many, but not all, states have extended the definition of parent to include other adult guardians. If parents meeting the state's definition cannot be located, a minor would often need to secure a judicial bypass.

*no data

title: Judicial Bypass
description:
States where a judge can excuse a minor from the required parental consent and/or notification. This is available in most states with restrictions, and in some you can be excused by a doctor.

*no data

title: Minor Consent
description:
States that either explicitly grant a minor the ability to consent to an abortion (through the law) or implicitly allow a minor to consent (because no law expressly requires parental involvement or because a parental involvement law was struck down in the courts).

*no data

title: Waiting Period
description:
States that have a mandatory waiting period. The number of hours someone must wait between receiving state mandated abortion counseling and obtaining an abortion. Note that all states waive mandatory waiting period requirements in a medical emergency or when the woman's life or health is threatened.

*no data

title: Counseling Visits
description:
States that have counseling required by the state and/ or ultrasound must be obtained at the facility before the waiting period begins, requiring two trips to the clinic.

*no data
